data.title: Theora Streams not played entirely
data.body:
This is kind of a weird behaviour as some Theora Streams on a VideoPlayer node seems just to be shrinked down by just not showing the last frames(approx 1sec)

I've done the test on 4 different ogv streams, and this is reproduced each time.

data.title: Fix array editor NodePath being relative to editor
data.body:
Makes the path relative to array property owner, if it's a node.

Closes #2392.

data.title: Write a documentation exporter to reStructuredText format
data.body:
As we're considering using readthedocs.org / Sphinx to generate Godot's online documentation based on a git repo instead of a conventional wiki CMS, we need to add support for yet another markup language to export the classes list to: reStructuredText (readthedocs.org also supports Markdown, but apparently provided many more features when using reST).

Pinging @shackra who already worked on the exporter for the Textile format, if you're willing to give a go at another markup language :)

I've already put an example of a class documented in reST: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/akien-mga/godot-test-wiki/master/classes/class_dictionary.rst
And the corresponding documentation entry: http://godot-wiki.readthedocs.org/en/latest/classes/class_dictionary.html

This reST was automatically converted from Markdown using Pandoc, so it's not necessarily the best output we can achieve, we can discuss first how it should look like before implementing it.

data.title: Can't create inherited scene based on already opened scene
data.body:
When clicking "New Inherited Scene" and selecting a base scene which is already opened in the editor, it will just change the focus to this base scene and not create an inherited scene.

If the base scene is _not_ opened, it works fine.

data.title: Crash when opening inherited scenes in tscn format
data.body:
Creating an inherited scene based on my scenes/towers/tower1.tscn scene in https://github.com/KOBUGE-Games/project-kumquat works fine, but then Godot crashes when trying to load the saved inherited scene (checkout this commit to reproduce: 239764d).

I get this error:

```
ERROR: get_dependencies: res://scenes/towers/tower2.tscn:5 - Parse Error: Unexpected end of file
   At: scene/resources/scene_format_text.cpp:606.
```

With this content saved in the inherited scene:

```
[gd_scene load_steps=2 format=1]

[ext_resource path="res://scenes/towers/tower1.tscn" type="PackedScene" id=1]

[node name="tower" instance=ExtResource( 1 )]

linear_damp = 0.1
damage = 5

[node name="attack_timer" parent="."]

wait_time = 0.2
```

Saving the base scene in XML to then create an XML-formatted inherited scene works fine, so it's a tscn parsing issue.

To reproduce:
- Clone https://github.com/KOBUGE-Games/project-kumquat
- Run `git checkout 239764d`
- Open the project and click "New Inherited Scene"
- Select "scenes/towers/tower1.tscn"
- Save it as "scenes/towers/tower2.tscn", and close it.
- Try to reopen the inherited scene, and see the crash.

data.title: Double-click item for reparent and choose a node in NodePath dialog
data.body: Small usability improvement, makes possible choose a node in reparent dialog, and in NodePath dialog, by double-clicking a item.

data.title: Metadata in tscn format
data.body:
The tscn format is already way VCS-friendlier than the XML format, so that's a big improvements.
The two remaining issues IMO are:
- random reordering of external resources upon save (#2495)
- editor-specific metadata that are saved to the tscn and change very often (whether on 2D or script screen, camera offset, etc.). This issue is about this point.

Here's what I get in a simple 2D tscn scene (as a one-liner, but I split it for readability):

```
__meta__ = {
    "__editor_plugin_screen__":"2D",
    "__editor_plugin_states__":{ 
        "2D":{ 
            "ofs":Vector2( -166.143, -66.5586 ),
            "snap_grid":true, 
            "snap_offset":Vector2( 0, 0 ), 
            "snap_pixel":false, 
            "snap_relative":false, 
            "snap_rotation":false, 
            "snap_rotation_offset":0, 
            "snap_rotation_step":0.261799, 
            "snap_show_grid":false, 
            "snap_step":Vector2( 16, 16 ), 
            "zoom":0.814506 }, 
        "3D":{ 
            "ambient_light_color":Color( 0.15, 0.15, 0.15, 1 ), 
            "default_light":true, 
            "default_srgb":false, 
            "deflight_rot_x":0.942478, 
            "deflight_rot_y":0.628319, 
            "fov":45, 
            "show_grid":true, 
            "show_origin":true, 
            "viewport_mode":1, 
            "viewports":[ 
                { "distance":4, "listener":true, "pos":Vector3( 0, 0, 0 ), "use_environment":false, "use_orthogonal":false, "x_rot":0, "y_rot":0 },
                { "distance":4, "listener":false, "pos":Vector3( 0, 0, 0 ), "use_environment":false, "use_orthogonal":false, "x_rot":0, "y_rot":0 },
                { "distance":4, "listener":false, "pos":Vector3( 0, 0, 0 ), "use_environment":false, "use_orthogonal":false, "x_rot":0, "y_rot":0 },
                { "distance":4, "listener":false, "pos":Vector3( 0, 0, 0 ), "use_environment":false, "use_orthogonal":false, "x_rot":0, "y_rot":0 } ],
            "zfar":500,
            "znear":0.1 },
        "Anim":{
            "visible":false } },
    "__editor_run_settings__":{
        "custom_args":"-l $scene",
        "run_mode":0 } }
```

I'll put some thoughts in a later comment on how these metadata could be made more VCS friendly.

data.title: Update libpng to latest 1.6.x version
data.body:
This is a followup on #2787, as I made a PR (#3058) to update libpng to the latest 1.5.x already, thus staying on the same branch.

Updating to 1.6.x would likely need more work, but should also be done in the long run IMO; I'm not sure how long 1.5.x will be supported upstream.

BTW I noticed that we have `-I/usr/include/libpng16` during the compilation already, does someone know how this external usage of libpng16 and simultaneous usage of builtin libpng15 works?

data.title: Update to libpng 1.5.26
data.body:
Includes numerous security fixes compared to the previous version which was around 1.5.7 or so.
Fixes #2787 

This was just a "drop new source files and go", and then Godot still seemed to build fine on X11 and run my projects properly. Might need some testing on other platforms first, though it's still the 1.5.x branch so I don't expect major breakages.

data.title: get_available_packet_count on PacketPeerStream
data.body:
Why is "get_available_packet_count()" always 0 when I send data from java to godot?

Reading data without "get_available_packet_count()" slows godot down.

Example client and java server
https://github.com/AlexHolly/godot-tcp-issue

data.title: sampleplayer controls cover help buttons
data.body: Go into the script tab, where you can see the "Tutorials", "Classes", and "Search Help" buttons.  Select a SamplePlayer in the scene tree, and its play, stop, and sample library controls will be on top of the help buttons.

data.title: Fix error string for Rect2 parser
data.body: Copy paste error from previous change

data.title: Error loading scene with "empty" Tilemap
data.body:
Steps to reproduce:
- Create a new scene and add a tilemap
- Save the scene as _.tscn_ and close it
- Now trying to load it results in: "Error loading scene"

Console error:

```
ERROR: poll: res://maps/map1.tscn:19 - Parse Error: Expected float in constructor
```

Scene Content:

```
[gd_scene format=1]

[node name="TileMap" type="TileMap"]

mode = 0
tile_set = null
cell/size = Vector2( 64, 64 )
cell/quadrant_size = 16
cell/custom_transform = Matrix32( 1, 0, 0, 1, 0, 0 )
cell/half_offset = 2
cell/tile_origin = 0
cell/y_sort = false
collision/use_kinematic = false
collision/friction = 1
collision/bounce = 0
collision/layers = 1
collision/mask = 1
occluder/light_mask = 1
tile_data = IntArray(  )
__meta__ = { "__editor_plugin_screen__":"2D", "__editor_plugin_states__":{ "2D":{ "ofs":Vector2( -86.7057, -49.4649 ), "snap_grid":false, "snap_offset":Vector2( 0, 0 ), "snap_pixel":false, "snap_relative":false, "snap_rotation":false, "snap_rotation_offset":0, "snap_rotation_step":0.261799, "snap_show_grid":false, "snap_step":Vector2( 10, 10 ), "zoom":3.42479 }, "3D":{ "ambient_light_color":Color( 0.15, 0.15, 0.15, 1 ), "default_light":true, "default_srgb":false, "deflight_rot_x":0.942478, "deflight_rot_y":0.628319, "fov":45, "show_grid":true, "show_origin":true, "viewport_mode":1, "viewports":[ { "distance":4, "listener":true, "pos":Vector3( 0, 0, 0 ), "use_environment":false, "use_orthogonal":false, "x_rot":0, "y_rot":0 }, { "distance":4, "listener":false, "pos":Vector3( 0, 0, 0 ), "use_environment":false, "use_orthogonal":false, "x_rot":0, "y_rot":0 }, { "distance":4, "listener":false, "pos":Vector3( 0, 0, 0 ), "use_environment":false, "use_orthogonal":false, "x_rot":0, "y_rot":0 }, { "distance":4, "listener":false, "pos":Vector3( 0, 0, 0 ), "use_environment":false, "use_orthogonal":false, "x_rot":0, "y_rot":0 } ], "zfar":500, "znear":0.1 }, "Anim":{ "visible":false } }, "__editor_run_settings__":{ "custom_args":"-l $scene", "run_mode":0 } }


```

From IRC:

```
<neikeq> Akien, just added a tileset, same result :P
<Akien> neikeq: And if you add a tile? :)
<neikeq> Akien, adding a tile works :o
<Akien> yep, that's because the issue is in: tile_data = IntArray(  )
```

data.title: Remove last remaining variables of PR-3043
Remove some outdated documentation and files
Add GDScript export hints for named bit flags, exponential ranges and global filesystem
data.body:
See discussion in #2988
This change exposes remaining sensible export hints:
- Named bit flags (`PROPERTY_HINT_FLAGS`)
  
  `export( int, FLAGS, "Fire", "Water", "Earth", "Wind" )`
- Exponential ranges (`PROPERTY_HINT_EXP_RANGE`)
  
  `export( float, EXP, 100, 200, 2 )`
- Global filesystem directories (`PROPERTY_HINT_GLOBAL_DIR`) restricted to tool scripts
  
  `export( String, DIR, GLOBAL )`
- Global filesystem files (`PROPERTY_HINT_GLOBAL_FILE`) restricted to tool scripts
  
  `export( String, FILE, GLOBAL, ".txt" )`

Closes #2988

data.title: Fix editor for TreeItem cells in range mode
data.body:
- Slider for editing TreeItems cells in range mode is currently only displayed
  with keyboard controls. With this change, it is also displayed with mouse
  input.
- Slider is currently not hidden when pressing enter in the text editor. It is
  now hidden.

These changes should make `PROPERTY_HINT_EXP_RANGE` more useful (working on this for #2988).

data.title: Fix setting Sliders in exponential mode
data.body:
Sliders in exponential mode are currently offset from the cursor.
This change should make `PROPERTY_HINT_EXP_RANGE` more useful (working on this for #2988).

data.title: Update Autoload demo
data.body:
The Autoload demo uses scene loading and changing as a usage example of autoload nodes. However, the new `current_scene` functionality simplifies this without the need for autoloads.

The demo now clarifies this and shows how to manually implement scene changing. Hopefully this will help users implementing more advanced techniques (e.g. interactive or threaded loading).

data.title: Fix "Play Project" button icon
data.body:
Regression from  #2696.

I'm sure I'm not the only who noticed _something_ is off about that button.

data.title: Do not focus script editor if using external editor
data.body: I configured settings to use an external editor. But if I open a script, the editor still switches to the Script tab (it does not open the script there though). This can be quite annoying.

data.body: Reverts godotengine/godot#3043

data.title: Script debugger remains visible when using Debug->Show Debugger
data.body: Closes #3031.

data.title: AREA_SPACE_OVERRIDE_REPLACE does not replace gravity/friction
data.body:
As seen in Body*SW::integrate_forces, areas marked as _REPLACE do not replace current gravity/friction with their own values. Instead, they add them to the total, and stop calculating.

If this is not a desirable behavior, I propose to split _REPLACE into two constants: One that _does_ replace values (and stops calculating), and other the combines values and stops (like it does now). Aditionally, a new constant could be made to replace values, but do not stop calculating.

data.title: Crash on rigidbody enter_shape with a set_contact_monitor(false) call
data.body:
I'm trying to disable collision for the player on enemy hit with this code on enter body

```
func _on_body_enter_shape( body_id, body, body_shape, local_shape ):
    self.set_contact_monitor(false)
```

This causes a crash for some reason, looking for debug dump on godot source code, the method who crash called by the player is:

```
void RigidBody2D::_body_inout(int p_status, ObjectID p_instance, int p_body_shape,int p_local_shape) 
```

It seems to be a problem with enter collision, disable on enter contact monitor and for some reason godot call exit collision and crash, maybe add a check for contact monitor bool here?.

video from the issue:
https://gfycat.com/LegitimateThunderousBorderterrier

Here is the simple demo from video which reproduce the problem and you could trace with debug:
https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/s/ktv2ltlufr9v19c/bug_collision.zip?dl=0

Tested with the last compiled godot from git today Dec 10, 2015 (https://github.com/godotengine/godot/commit/3b68f0d051ac33a95e78025622c5f93219591da9)

So, I don't know if this is a bug or is the intended behaviour and if I should use another simple alternative for disable/enable ALL rigidbody collisions on player respawn/death animation?

data.title: Array pop_front() doesn't exist
data.body:
In the tutorial (https://github.com/godotengine/godot/wiki/tutorial_gdscript_efficiently) there is a reference to pop_front():

```
In dynamically typed languages, arrays can also double as other datatypes, such as lists:

var array = []
array.append(4)
array.append(5)
array.pop_front()
```

But in the page about array (https://github.com/godotengine/godot/wiki/class_array) there is no pop_front(), from what I tested in godot it seems pop_front() really doesn't exist yet.

Maybe the tutorial should be updated to reflect this or the function could be developed.

data.title: Fix "in" operator, make it use evaluate() instead of operator==
data.body: Closes #1405.

data.title: Fix error message when using is_connected with a script signal
data.body: Closes #2687.

data.title: Camera2D smoothing and drag margins not working together.
data.body: When the Camera2D has a smoothing above 0 the camera will stay centered and not use the drag margins anymore. To replicate this you can open the 2D platformer demo and set the camera smoothing on the player scene to something above 0 and turn the drag margins on.
